answers.author: Dustin Rief
answers.text:
I have done a lot of research on how other municipalities portray their information to the public and the only city I have seen that does it is Richmond, VA. Here is a link https://richssl.ci.richmond.va.us/applications/GIS/snowmap/   I would contact their Public Works Department to see how it was received.

answers.author: Scott Schroyer
answers.text:
Kristoffer:
We (City of Hudson, Ohio) implemented a GPS snow plow program about 6 years ago, and then quickly expanded it to include the remaining PW vehicles.  We share the information publicly on our website and leverage more features internally through the vendor provided website at GPSinsight.  I initiated the program when I was the Asst. PW Director and worked with our GIS staff to develop the AVL mapping portion.  I’d be happy to discuss the project details/costs with you further if you have an interest. 
For AVL sight info, go to:  
http://gis.hudson.oh.us/HudsonSL/ Go to the Applications pull down menu on the top right tool bar, and then select AVL. You should be able to view real time vehicle data.

author: Kristoffer Simpson
text:
Can anyone share their experience with implementing a snow plow GPS system, particularly those who make real-time snow plow progress available for public view? 
How has this system been received? What are the costs of implementation? Have there been any unexpected advantages or challenges? Is there anything else I should know?
title: Snow Plow GPS for Public View
